intro: Llerasia lindenii, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Llerasia lindenii typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to the bark of trees in its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high levels of air humidity for optimal growth.
